runs.comm: that's the way to get things started! Forget the Gayle storm, Smith is whipping up something tropical, a fruity, one-legged pull over deep square leg for six first ball!
slightly back of a length, better line and Smith gets patiently in behind this one
strays down the leg side, touch full and there's just a tickle of bat, sending the ball racing to the fine leg rope
another boundary, this time a short-arm pull through midwicket! Brutal stroke from Smith, picked up a back of a length ball and murdered it through the on side
four more, three in a row for Smith! Too full outside off and Smith leans out to play a gorgeous square drive, between two fielders, no one is catching that either
tighter line on off, Smith defends a length ball into the covers... but Broad had overstepped
Smith goes down on one knee and tries to deposit this into the ocean but takes an air swipe at a length ball that climbs outside off
good length in the channel outside off... and, wouldn't you know it, Gayle shoulders arms and lets it through
quicker and fuller, this seems to duck back a little late and catches Gayle slightly leaden-footed, he drops the bat on off and it just passes outside
slightly full and straightening on the pads, clipped through backward square for one
length ball, tight line on off stump, Smith goes across and shows it a straight bat
majestic from Smith, little bit of width and he lasers a drive on the up through cover point
good comeback, off-stump line and this skips off the pitch, catches Smith on the gloves as he pushes at it
decent pace from Bresnan, 85mph, lets this one go outside off
gets across and pats this one gently back down the track
leading edge but it drops short of mid-off! This stuck in the surface a little, Gayle nearly miscuing off his railway sleeper of a bat
beaten over the top of the stumps this time, advancing a little tentatively and swinging the arms, Bresnan made sure to follow him
tight lines from Bresnan, who coaxes another forward defensive out of Gayle
length ball, on the stumps, worked short of mid-on and he lumbers through for one - good over from Bresnan
another massive leading edge... lands safely between mid-on and mid-off. This definitely swung back at Gayle, who played across the line, again gets away with it
drops a touch short and Smith shows good bat speed to whip a pull to fine leg for another boundary
Dernbach is sticking to regulation pace and a decent length so far, Smith lets this be outside off
slightly full, just drawing Smith forward and the ball holds its line, squirts towards short third man off the outer half of the bat, they steal one
pitched up on leg stump, attempted flick to leg and it roll short off the pad
touching 90mph now from Dernbach, fullish on off stump, defensive poke from Smith
drops short, easy medium pace and this is lashed over midwicket, just a swing of the arms and it disappears for Gayle's first boundary
short again, Gayle backs off and thrashes this down the ground, baseball style for a flat four. The Kraken awakes?
pitched up on leg stump, Gayle has to dig this out and it goes quickly to mid-on
down the ground now, full and around off stump, Gayle blasts it flat back over Bresnan's head, just a couple of bounces to the fence. Dismissive power
steps away again, Bresnan follows him, pulls aggressively into the ground through midwicket
full and straight, maybe a touch quicker, Smith miscues into covers
length ball on off stump, Gayle goes across and defends first up
smoked, on to the roof! Gayle has found his hitting zone and is making himself comfortable, slightly too full from Stokes and a vicious swipe sends this sailing many a mile over long-on
another boundary, this time pulled flat behind square, not the cleanest of connections but it beats the despairing dive on the rope
Gayle backs away, trying to free the arms again, Stokes pitches it up outside leg and a thick inside edge screws behind backward square
fullish, outside off, Smith drives in front of square but can't get it through
tighter from Stokes, not quite driveable on off and Smith pushes defensively into the off side
round the wicket, Buttler up to the stumps, Gayle works it through square leg for one

bowled him, nipping back through the gate! Bopara has done the trick, on the mark straight away and Smith was perhaps a little early on his shot, trying to work to leg, think the ball gripped off the surface and was accurate enough to disturb the bails
class, what a stroke to begin with, drops back and cuts a length ball past point, played late and on the up for four
drops back in the crease and glides one to third man
goes back round the wicket, holds up off the pitch again and another leading edge from Gayle's brute of a bat loops into the off side, just in front of point
tight line on the stumps, skidding on and flicked to short fine leg for one
tossed up from round the wicket, Gayle comes forward to defend
bit of air, straightening on off, again Gayle taps it watchfully back
lbw appeal, as Gayle attempts to sweep and misses, hit on the front pad but the umpire adjudges it to be missing leg... Hawk-Eye suggests it was just clipping
goes back and pushes a single back past the bowler to long-on
continues round the wicket, worked to square leg
gets a piece of this, good footwork from Samuels, larrups the ball flat down the ground but there's a long-off and that keeps them to one
cutter from Bopara, angled in towards middle and off, glanced behind square leg for a single
another miscue from Gayle, who hoicks a top edge towards mid-on, which is currently vacant
pitched up, knocked back down the ground to long-on
round the wicket, short of a length, Gayle reaches down and pats it behind square for one more
out the back of the hand, down the leg side and Samuels finds the fielder with a flick
full and arrowing on middle and leg, can't dig it out and the ball trickles back to Bopara
tossed up, Gayle leans out and pokes square on the off side

tossed up, on off stump and Gayle hits against the turn, plopping Tredwell on to the corrugated iron roof at deep midwicket. This one isn't coming back, either. Gayle just watches it go from behind his shades
flatter and quicker, beats the bat and deflects off the pad short on the leg side
Samuels comes forward, Tredwell spots him and drags his length down, collects the ball in his follow through
again Tredwell checks Samuels on the walk, can only work it to mid-on
touch short, this time Samuels goes back in the crease and forces a couple through the covers
he hammers another down the ground, short from round the wicket and it swings it straight of long-on...Bresnan didn't have far to move
on the short side again, pulled into midwicket this time without quite the same timing
full on the pads, flicked behind square and placed well enough for a comfortable second
delivered from wide on the crease, angling in to middle, defended
back of a length, on off stump, played square and can't beat backward point
full outside, he leans into a languid cover drive which finds the sweeper
round the wicket, worked off the pads to deep square
he's swinging at fresh air, a length ball that spins slow away from Gayle as he aims a powerful shot through midwicket
and he's got him! Reward for Tredwell who has held his ground against Gayle. This one slid on and stuck him on the back pad right in from of middle. Unless he hit it, that was dead.
gets across onto off stump and works this delivery into the leg side
comes down the pitch and drives this in the air over the off side, almost beaten in the flight but places it between deep cover and long-off
pushed into the off side, can't beat cover
back of a length outside off, opens the face and finds backward point
just gets this over cover, short of a length and he leant back, didn't quite get it from the middle but had enough bat on it to clear the leaping fielder
that's served up a lovely hittable length, Samuels swings through the line and drives it one bounce to the long-on boundary
not good from Stokes, short again and this time Samuels pulls it high over midwicket
he's not really learning...having strengthened the leg-side field, Stokes drops this short outside off and Samuels carves it over backward point
angled into the body, nudged to the leg side and weighted just right so he can come back for a second
uses his feet, it's short on leg stump, worked through midwicket
tries to tuck this through the leg side but only gets it back to the bowler
dragged down a touch short, Samuels goes onto the back foot and drives to deep cover
he moves to the leg side, Tredwell follows him and cramps Simmons for room so he can only find cover
excellent from Tredwell, no width again and it's pushed back down the pitch
and it's a dot ball to finish, Simmons pushes a length ball to cover
cuts his fingers across the ball, outside off, opens the face to short third man
it's short, but it gets the wicket...sat in the pitch a fraction, Simmons went for the pull, but got the ball too straight instead of midwicket, long-on didn't have to move far to his left
gets an edge first ball, runs fine of third man but he's able to get around
length ball outside off, flayed through the covers but doesn't beat the sweeper
very full, on the popping crease outside off, driven square through point
another slower ball, an off spinner, grips a touch and the batsman is early on his shot
follows him as he moves to leg, Russell pushes into the off side
fingertips! Morgan leaping at backward point. It's short of a length outside, Samuels drives off the back foot with an open face and it wasn't really a chance. Would have been miraculous
plays and misses this time as he tries a similar shot square of the wicket
full outside leg, again following the batsman shuffles, flicked in the air through the leg side
lovely delivery, hint shape away on a good length, Russell is stood on leg stump and is feeling for it...gets beaten
short of a length, pulled firmly down to long-on
full toss outside off, clubs it through midwicket and although it wasn't from the middle it beat long-on
one of those wide yorkers they tried in the first ODI, this one works as Russell gives himself too much room and drives over the top of it
a straight yorker this time, and it costs four! Just a thick inside edge, beat short fine-leg and square leg then neither could chase it down
slower ball, he's swinging might hard again but just gets a think bottom edge to the leg side
clever from Bresnan, follows the batsman then yorks him between his legs well outside leg stump. Good take from Buttler
keeping it yorker-length, this is driven out to deep point...good over from Bresnan
dropped and it's a clanger! Dernbach served up length, Samuels drills his cover drive but couldn't have picked out Tredwell any better on the edge of the ring at cover
and, as so often happens, the next ball finds the boundary. He leans from his previous mistake, opens the stance a touch more and places this wide of cover. Fizzes off the bat
goes for a yorker, comes out as a low full toss, driven powerfully straight down the ground to bring up a 37-ball fifty...margin of error is tiny for the bowler. That catch already costly.
slower ball, back of the hand, Samuels swings hard and gets a thick outside edge which loops over short third man...three boundaries a row
that is inches away from a perfect yorker and gets driven straight down the ground...the power compensates for it coming off the bottom of the bat
five in a row! How's Tredwell feeling? This wasn't a good delivery, a length slower ball which Samuels waits a fraction longer for a cuts through backward point
this yorker at leg stumps gets driven down to long-on
low full toss, it's driven into the pitch and straight back to the bowler
a length delivery, angled into the pads, Bresnan perhaps a little fortunate that Samuels was early on the shot...ball dribbles to the leg side
fantastic shot! Quite hard to describe. The ball was almost out of reach outside off, he was moving to leg, but he caught up with and almost lifted himself off his feet as he drove over point
clubbed down the ground
poor delivery, full and angling into the pads, a conventional leg glance beats short fine-leg
heaves a length delivery through midwicket and a bit surprising they didn't run a second there
follows him a yorker outside leg, gets a thick inside edge out to deep square-leg
keeps it full outside leg, Russell can't free his arms and can only drive down to long-on
think this was actually a low full toss that Samuels played over the top off, scoots past leg stump...keeping the ball full
this is a much bigger full toss but he can only swing it out to deep square...excellent over with a ball remaining
super stuff this over, another yorker up at leg stump which just takes a thick edge to the leg side. Well bowled.
